page.title: 07Horton Common Redman's Hill
page.content: LINEAR DYKE This crosses a low spur extending S.E.from Redman's Hill barrows & is bisected by a railway cutting,which is now disused.The dyke is 675yards long with twin banks,the later parts of which are medieval(estate boundary?) the earlier are Bronze Age.The SSE end of dyke ends in marshy ground & NNE ends on S. bank of river Crane. FOOTNOTES Bowl Barrow a round barrow looking like an upturned bowl, the centre of which usually contains a timber or stone cyst,housing human remains & artefacts.Often containing later burials dug into earthworks,such as barrel urns.Some later burials Saxon. Barrel Urn clay or stone pot into which ashes are placed.Bronze Age. S.Lodge,is a special type of barrel urn only found in S.England.
